title: With Praise And Thanksgiving
author: Arthur Tappan Pierson (1837-1911)
presentation: v1 c v2 c v3 c v4 c v5 c

v1: With praise and thanksgiving there stands a great throng
In the presence of Jesus and sing this new song.
v2: All these once were sinners, defiled in His sight,
Now arrayed in pure garments, in praise they unite.
v3: He maketh the rebel a priest and a king,
He hath bought us, and taught us this new song to sing.
v4: How helpless and hopeless we sinners had been,
If He never had loved us till cleansed from our sin.
v5: Aloud in His praises our voices shall ring,
So that others, believing, this new song shall sing.
c1: Unto Him Who hath loved us and washed us from sin,
Unto Him be the glory forever! Amen!
